title: IP system doesn't reward wins enough
body:
Forgive me if I'm wrong about the exact numbers but what I'm saying holds true.

20-minute losses net 150 IP/hr.
20-minute win nets 210/hr
55-minute wins net ~150/hr
55-minute loss nets ~110/hr?

The values might be off but what I'm saying holds true.

I don't think you get paid enough for long wins or long losses. Alternatively, I think you get paid too much for short losses. Currently I still need a lot of IP and I find myself in situations where it's 20-minutes into a game and my team might have like a 40% chance or even 20% chance of winning the game. My team wants to continue the game, but when they do, my IP per hour drops below the 150/hr from the quick loss.

If we made longer game duration wins pay out more IP, then the risk of losing your IP/hr (when you have a set number of hours per day / per human lifetime that you can play) would be more balanced by the reward when you did win.

I think the person that designed this at riot is paying the minimum IP to keep people in the game, as I suppose they should, but damn this sucks. It would be better to get together with a group of friends and play 20-minute losses unless you were crushing (70%+ likely to win).

replies.body: I have no job or personal life right now do to personal reasons and play litterally 10-12 hours a day, and still dont get nearly enough ip to even consider getting 6300 or even 4800 champs with ip, let alone runes. I feel it needs a medium sized increase in order to keep people with actually lives able to still buy and use champions and give them more incentive to play the game. Half the fun is trying out new things.

To be completely honest I think the system is in place in this form to try and encourage you to pick up more RP and buy more champions with RP saving your IP for runes as they're only able to be bought with IP, and not cheaply for that matter either. 820 IP for a simple hybrid pen mark that's like 6 wins in order to buy a single rune when you need 9 of them for a proper page. The win of the day helps, but in all honesty that's still really steep. Not to mention half the meta picks in the game for champions are all 6300 champions.

I don't blame riot, people have to make money, but still.
I recommend T1 runes over T3 runes if you want some cheap stats.

Well...Maybe. I mean, When it comes down to it, the difference between a tier 2 and 3 rune isn't really that fantastic, stacked or not. If you've got one player with tier 2 runes and they're just better, and another with tier 3 runes who plays even the slightest bit worse, the difference is irrelevant.

Runes provide only the smallest difference compared to just how well you know your stuff. Masteries, which happen to be free and fully and infinitely refundable, are far more important.

I would never recommend to anyone to purchase more than one champion with RP, if any. It's just not worth it unless you've really got your eye on one in particular. If you stick with the game long enough, you'll have more IP than you'll really know what to do with.

Maybe new players don't know that and intrinsically believe that the expensive ones are better without knowing ahead of time that they really aren't at their level. At a starter level with little to no knowledge of how this hopelessly complex game works, it doesn't matter whom you pick. At all.

All I'm saying is that you can put off Runes all you want. Tier 2's are cheap and frankly, when it comes down to rune power versus knowledge of the game, almost as good as Tier 3's anyway. By the time you want to move up in Ranked, you'll have way more than enough IP for all the Tier 3's to decide upon. Until then, it's just up to how well you're learning the game, not how good your runes are.

ok so the first 5 or so replies to this thread ... I don't even know what you guys were reading. I was talking about the balance between IP gain per win and IP gain per loss...

???

This means that if I surrender at 20, even if I can win but it will just take ~35 more minutes will boost the rate Ip I get?

An by allowing the game to drag on for that long, we risk ending up with 40 less Ip to gain the same amount of Ip we would have gotten if we just ff'd at 20.

That means there is no reason for a game to last longer than ~20 minutes and whenever the Ip/hr begins to decrease, a losing team, even if its possible to win with the game just lasting much longer, should always ff around 20.

No wonder so many people just surrender. O_O

There's strong points to both sides. There's no denying that Riot is a business first. However if one does insist on doing everything with ip then they will be needing a lot of time. But can I just point out that there is no reason to own all the champs.

There are those champs who a person will never want to play and therefore have no reason to buy him. Also if you're seeking to try out a champ freeweek is a much more logical choice to test someone instead of buying them blind. Also regardless of what our skill level is there are some champs we just don't do well with.

The only counter argument that I can foresee is for the purpose of trading in ranked and draft. Granted it is useful to trade champs in select in order to avoid first picking a vital choice. But between four other people there is great chance that between the five there will be a way to make a trade work out.

If you disagree with this I welcome the opportunity to discuss it with anyone. That said please keep in mind that I would intend to keep said discussion civil.
